patient_info: Proteinuria,Glomerulonephritis,Hearing impairment,Visual loss,Fever,Hypercholesterolemia,Elevated circulating creatinine concentration,Elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate,Recurrent tonsillitis,Abnormal urinary color,Macroscopic hematuria
golden_diagnosis: Alport syndrome, X-linked,Alport syndrome 2, autosomal recessive,Alport syndrome 3, autosomal dominant,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Goodpasture's Disease - systemic autoimmune disorder primarily affecting skin and kidney with proteinuria and glomerulonephritis.
2. Lupus-like Syndrome - systemic autoimmune disorder characterized by proteinuria, glomerulonephritis, and other organs involvement with similar clinical presentation like hearing impairment, visual loss, and recurrent tonsillitis.
3. Pemphigus-like Syndrome - systemic autoimmune disorder that results in skin blisters and kidney impairment with proteinuria and nephrotic syndrome-like presentation.
4. Minimal Change Disease - primary glomerular disorder characterized by proteinuria, glomerulonephritis, and elevated circulating creatinine concentration.
5. Diabetic Nephropathy - complication of diabetes that leads to kidney failure, characterized by proteinuria, glomerulonephritis, and elevated circulating creatinine concentration.
6. Fabry Disease - lysosomal storage disorder characterized by proteinuria, glomerulonephritis, hearing impairment, and visual loss with elevated circulating cholesterolemic concentration.
7. Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome (HUS) - acute kidney disease with proteinuria, glomerulonephritis, and microangiopathic hemolytic anemia caused by dysfunction of the endothelial cells.
8. Lyme Disease - inflammatory disease caused by Borrelia bacteria and characterized by proteinuria, glomerulonephritis, hearing impairment, visual loss, chronic recurrent tonsillitis, abnormal urinary color, and elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate.
9. Giant Cell Arteritis (GCA) - age-related autoimmune disorder affecting arteries and characterized by proteinuria, glomerulonephritis, and elevated circulating inflammatory markers.
10. Antisynthetase Syndrome (ASS) - rare autoimmune disorder characterized by proteinuria, glomerulonephritis, and inflammation involving multiple organs such as lungs, liver, and kidneys with hearing impairment, visual loss, and recurrent tonsillitis.
